summary:
The British Army is the land warfare force of the United Kingdom, including the British Overseas Territories and Crown Dependencies. It's part of the British Armed Forces, along with the Naval Service and the Royal Air Force. As of January 1, 2024, the British Army has over 110,000 personnel, including full-time soldiers, Gurkhas, volunteers, and other staff.

The Army's history dates back to 1707 when England and Scotland united to form Great Britain, combining their armies. The British Army is commanded by the monarch and administered by the Ministry of Defence. It has fought in many significant wars, helping Britain become a global power. Today, it continues to be deployed in various conflict zones worldwide.
title: British Army
